result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Bear Downwind was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation on 07/07/22 by 09:00AM. 
- 2 days credit against ultimate sentence 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- DNA Sample

- Subject to testing at Agents request
- No Contact with Village Liquor Store, J.W.I and B.J.B .

4:05 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Bradley Bear Downwind in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Bradley Bear Downwind.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF83 and 22CM70. There is an agreement. ADA Becker recites agreement. Count 1 in case 2022CF83 is amended to 943.23(3)(a) - operate motor vehicle w/o consent, class I felony. ADA Becker to file an amended information by end of day, June 7, 2022. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to AMENDED count 1 in 2022CF83. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of AMENDED Ct 1 in 2022CF83. On motion of the State without objection, Court READS in and dismisses 2022CM70. Sentencing recommendations. 
Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation with conditions: 
- $250 DNA surcharge, payable through DOC
- $268 in felony court costs, payable through DOC 
- 60 days in SCC Jail - STAYED
- DNA Sample
- Restitution to be determined within 60 days.
- AODA and follow through with recommendations and comply with AODA plan
- Comply with COMPASS and any programming recommended by DOC.
- Absolute sobriety 
- Subject to testing at agents discretion 
- No contact with victims in case 22CF83 and 22CM70. 

Report to probation by 9 am on July 7, 2022. 
2 days credit in the event of revocation.
Status conference on July 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
From Court to Counsel and DE. Court quashes warrant. New hearing to be scheduled. arc

per RMW. hml

from RMW to all counsel. DE appeared via zoom on wrong date. Quash warrants and hearing will be reset when JA returns to office. hml

Pretrial Assessment Report. arc   SEALED

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF83 & 22CM70:

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Village Liquor.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Justin I.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
